description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary conditions 6 (Car Parking), 8 (Electric Vehicle Charging Points) and 20 (Hours of Operation), seeking to extend the proposed opening hours and to vary the wording of conditions 6 and 8 (to being compliance conditions) pursuant to planning permission Ref: 181037FUL dated 28.09.2018 for 'Construction of part single-storey and part two-storey building for use as a sports centre comprising of gymnasium and fitness studio spaces, changing facilities and ancillary staff offices (following demolition of building)'
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | 2	The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-GF-DR-A-2001 Ground Floor GA Plan-P02;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-01-DR-A-2001 First Floor GA Plan-P03;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-RF-DR-A-2001 Roof GA Plan-P03;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-ZZ-DR-A-0051 Perspective View from Park Entrance-P01;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-ZZ-DR-A-0052 Aerial View-P01;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-ZZ-DR-A-0053 View from West-P01;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-ZZ-DR-A-0054 View looking South East from within UWL
o	Site-P01;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-ZZ-DR-A-0055 View from Kerrison Road-P01;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-ZZ-DR-A-3001 GA Elevations Sheet 1-P02;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-ZZ-DR-A-3002 GA Elevations Sheet 2-P02;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-ZZ-DR-A-4001 GA Section-P02.
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-00-DR-L-1011 Location Plan-P02;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-00-DR-L-1004 Block Plan-P02;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-00-DR-L-1002 Existing Site Plan-P02;
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-00-DR-L-1003 Proposed Site Plan-P02.
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-00-DR-L-1007 Proposed Site Plan-P02 (Covered Cycle stands locations)
o	UWLSC-BBA-00-00DR-L-7004 Landscape Details (Cycle shelter details)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The development shall be maintained in accordance with the details of materials associated with ref. 190417CND dated: 26.03.2019.
Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policy 7.4 of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).

| The Construction Management Plan approved under consent 185195CND dated 03.01.2019 shall be implemented in full on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of the construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and policies D9, D12 , T7 and SI1 of the London Plan(2021). | Notwithstanding the submitted current Travel Plan (2015 - 2020) produced by Steer Davies Gleave R02-BB 180618, a revised and detailed Travel Plan shall be submitted prior to occupation designed to manage the transport needs of the occupiers of the development, including measures to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. A revised and updated travel plan to that submitted in support of planning application shall be submitted to address the additional use proposed which should be designed to manage the transport needs of staff and visitors to the site (including targets and monitoring) to minimise car usage (inconjuction with the revised parking policy as detailed in condition 6) and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be  submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, which shall be in  accordance with Tfl's updated planning guidance. The travel plan as approved shall be implemented in connection with the hotel use hereby approved, and shall be retained in operation thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. Thereafter, an annual monitoring report shall be submitted to the local planning authority, unless otherwise requested.

Reason: To promote sustainable modes of transport, and to ensure that the development does not exacerbate congestion on the local road network, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies T1 and T3 of the London Plan (2021); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG. | Notwithstanding the Travel Statement prepared by Steer Davies Gleave, the approved Car Parking Policy Statement prepared by The
University West London shall be brought into use and retained permanently. This shall be included in the annual monitoring report associated with the Travel Plan.

Reason: To promote sustainable modes of transport, and to ensure that the development does not exacerbate congestion on the local road network, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies T1 and T3 of the London Plan (2021); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG. | Prior to the first occupation of the development the provision of at least 116 short stay cycle parking spaces (58 Sheffield stands) as shown in plan UWLSC-BBA-00-00-DR-L-1003 Proposed Site Plan-P02 shall be carried out to the specifications and adopted standards of the London Plan and the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy T4 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(k) and (g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG | In Accordance with drawings 2022.114-P.02 and 2022.114-P.03, the provision of two active Electric Vehicle Charging Points (EVCP) for the
gym (EVCP) for a minimum of 20% of the car parking spaces and an additional one passive provision of the car parking spaces for the
exclusive use for the gym shall be retained permanently.

Reason: To ensure adequate provision of electric vehicle charging in accordance with policies T1 and T3 of the London Plan (2021); policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) 1.1(g) and 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | The 30 car parking spaces shown on the approved plan UWLSC-BBA-00-00-DR-L-1003 Proposed Site Plan-P02 shall be formed prior to first occupation of the sports centre, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policies T1 and T3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan. | The external noise level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 5dBA in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy D6 of the London Plan 2021; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (April, 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the Council's SPG10: Noise and Vibration. | Prior to use, any machinery, plant or equipment (including extract/ ventilation system and ducting) at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy D6 of the London Plan 2021; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (April, 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the Council's SPG10: Noise and Vibration. | Exercise equipment and speakers shall be fully isolated from the building structure by use of proprietary anti- vibration mounts and materials.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy D6 of the London Plan 2021; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (April, 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the Council's SPG10: Noise and Vibration. | The permitted use shall not commence until all external doors to the exercise rooms have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time shall any external door nor windows be fixed in an open position.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy D6 of the London Plan 2021; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (April, 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the Council's SPG10: Noise and Vibration. | The development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the Arboricultural Impact Assessment produced by RPS and the tree protection measures contained within the report during until completion of construction in accordance with BS 5837:1991.

Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area. | The refuse and recycling shown on the approved drawings shall be provided prior to the first occupation and retained thereafter.

Reason: To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy S17 of the London Plan (2021); policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 7A, LV7.4 and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013); and (interim) SPG 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any of the buildings within the development unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under this condition prior to installation.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole, in accordance with policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policies 3.5 and 7.4 and policies 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The drainage scheme as approved through ref. 192611CND dated: 08.08.2019, shall be maintained in accordance with the details submitted.

Reason: To ensure that adequate drainage of the site is carried out as approved, in accordance with policy SI13 of the adopted London Plan (2021). | The proposed external lighting scheme shall be designed to reduce light pollution to nearby residents, and road users and where applicable the recommendations of the following guidance shall be met:
o	ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011.
o	Institution of Lighting Professionals Technical Report PLG05, Brightness of Illuminated advertisements, 2015.
o	CIE Technical Report- Guide on the Limitation of the Effects of Obtrusive Light from Outdoor Lighting Installations - CIE 150: 2003.
o	Statutory Nuisance from Insects and Artificial Light by Department of Environment Food. Guidance on sections 101, 102 and 103 of the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005, Defra

Reason: To provide a safe and secure external environment and to safeguard the amenities of future occupiers of the development and surrounding properties in accordance with policies 1.1(h) & (j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012) and with policy 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Ealing Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) Note 8: Safer Ealing. | All refuse collections shall not occur between 8pm and 7am and there shall be no and rubbish collections on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and preserve and maintain the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring residential properties, in accordance with policy S17 of the London Plan 2021, policies 1.1 (j) of the adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policy 7A of the adopted  Ealing's Development Management Document (2013). | The hours of operation for the sports centre hereby approved shall be limited to the following hours:
Monday to Sunday (including Bank Holidays): 7:30am - 10:00pm
All activity shall cease 30 minutes after closing.

Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and preserve and maintain the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring residential properties, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1 (j) of the adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policy 7A of the adopted  Ealing's Development Management Document (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), the development hereby approved shall only be used as a sports centre comprised of gymnasium and fitness studio spaces, changing facilities and ancillary staff offices, and not for any other use without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality, impacts and provision of any change of use, and to safeguard the amenity of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 7A, and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).
